page.title: 16THE STEYNE - SW.BOGNOR REGIS
page.content: {The Steyne}is one of the most interesting roads in our area. The area is subject to a{preservation {order}and ,therefore, the exterior of the houses remain as they were in {Georgian}times though many have been converted into flats.Down the centre of the roadway is a{communal garden which is now maintained by the council.In{The Steyne}is{Bath House where in the late{1800's}sea water baths could be taken.Hot baths cost 2s and cold 1s.At the sea-end of the Steyne is a{drinking fountain}which was built on the Promenade to commemorate the{Diamond Jubilee of {Queen Victoria.}It was moved to{The {Steyne}in 1969 after being rescued from a council yard.Today's residents are concerned about the number of cars being parked there by shoppers and about the dogs fouling the gardens.
